item.title: Fighting the Trump
item.description:
Fighting the Trump

THERE they go again. The neocons who led the George W. Bush administration into Iraq are now touting a fresh crusade to save American democracy - and the Republican Party - from an authoritarian foe: Donald J. Trump. Their campaign began with an impassioned essay in The American Interest last month by Eliot A.

item.title: Catching Banksy - the maths of it.
item.description:
Catching Banksy - the maths of it.

British academics have used a combinations of maths, criminology and geographic profiling to back up a theory over the identity of mysterious street artist Banksy. Scientists at Queen Mary University of London said the pattern of how Banksy's artworks were distributed suggested he was artist Robin Gunningham.

item.title: The Brillouin zones of a square crystal lattice in two dimensions, which underlie the analysis of waves propagating through the crystal. Image: R R Hogan, University of Cambridge
